intro: Udora lithuanica, commonly known as the Lithuanian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Udora lithuanica has lance-shaped leaves and produces showy blooms from late spring to early summer. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and natural habitats.
